FullText:
Tiger Barb, Giant

This fish has a striped pattern like that of a tiger. It swims aggressively towards anything that draws too near.


Giant Tiger Barb

CR 2

XP 600
N Large animal (aquatic)
Init +2; Senses low-light vision, scent; Perception +9
DEFENSE
AC 13, touch 11, flat-footed 11 (+2 Dex, +2 natural, -1 size)
hp 22 (4d8+4)
Fort +5, Ref +6, Will +2
OFFENSE
Spd swim 50 ft.
Melee bite +5 (1d8+3)
Space 10 ft.; Reach 10 ft.
STATISTICS
Str 14, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Base Atk +3; CMB +6; CMD 18 (can't be tripped)
Feats Skill Focus (Perception), Weapon Focus (bite)
Skills Perception +9, Swim +15
ECOLOGY
Environment temperate and warm aquatic
Organization pack (2-5) or school (6-11)
Treasure none

The giant tiger barb is peach with black-striped gills that resemble the stripes of a tiger. It is 10 to 15 feet long and weighs about 50 pounds.

Tiger barbs sustain themselves on a diet of plants, but eat any sort of food if hungry. They are very territorial and attack anything that enters their domain.

Copyright Notice Author Scott Greene.
AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Name: Giant Tiger Barb
